{"step_by_step_thinking": "At 6 weeks of age, the baby's reproductive system is still in the early stages of development. The ovaries of a female fetus contain all the oocytes (eggs) she will have for her entire life. These oocytes are formed during fetal development and are arrested in prophase of the first meiotic division until puberty. Therefore, the correct answer is B. The baby's oocytes are arrested in prophase.", "answer_choice": "B"}
